member.summary: Returns S3Object provider.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the given path refers to an existing directory on disk.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.CreateDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Creates all directories and subdirectories as specified by path.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.EnumerateFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file names that match a search pattern in a specified path.
member.param: The relative or absolute path to the directory to search. This string is not case-sensitive.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of the full names (including paths) for the files in the directory specified by and that match the specified search pattern.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.EnumerateFilesCore(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file names that match a search pattern in a specified path.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.GetFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the names of files (including their paths) that match the specified search pattern in the specified directory.
member.param: The relative or absolute path to the directory to search. This string is not case-sensitive.
member.returns: An array of the full names (including paths) for the files in the specified directory that match the specified search pattern, or an empty array if no files are found.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.EnumerateDirectories(System.String,System.String,CMS.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of directory names that match a search pattern in a specified path, and optionally searches subdirectories.
member.param: The relative or absolute path to the directory to search. This string is not case-sensitive.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or should include all subdirectories.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of the full names (including paths) for the directories in the directory specified by and that match the specified search pattern and option.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.EnumerateDirectoriesCore(System.String,System.String,CMS.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of directory names that match a search pattern in a specified path, and optionally searches subdirectories.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.Directory.GetDirectories(System.String,System.String,CMS.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Gets the names of the subdirectories (including their paths) that match the specified search pattern in the current directory, and optionally searches subdirectories.
member.param: The relative or absolute path to the directory to search. This string is not case-sensitive.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the search operation should include all subdirectories or only the current directory.
member.returns: An array of the full names (including paths) of the subdirectories that match the specified criteria, or an empty array if no directories are found.

member.summary: Creates a new file, write the contents to the file, and then closes the file. If the target file already exists, it is overwritten.

member.summary: Opens a file, appends the specified string to the file, and then closes the file. If the file does not exist, this method creates a file, writes the specified string to the file, then closes the file.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.FileStream.InitMultiPartUpload
member.summary: Inits multipart upload for given path.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.FileStream.UploadStreamContentAsMultiPart(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Uploads stream's content to Amazon S3 storage as one part of the file in multipart upload process identified by .
member.remarks: Always returns one ETag in collection. If stream's length is more than 5GB then exception is thrown.
member.param: Unique identifier for one multipart upload. Can be obtained by .
Number that defines position of the data obtained by the stream in the whole multipart upload process.
member.returns: One unique identifier of the uploaded part in collection.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.FileStream.CompleteMultiPartUploadProcess(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Uploads one large file to Amazon S3 storage in smaller parts.
member.remarks: Stream still needs to be disposed.
member.param: Unique identifier for one multipart upload. Can be obtained by method.
List of identifiers from Amazon S3 received after uploading each part by method.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.FileStream.AbortMultiPartUpload(System.String)
member.summary: Aborts multipart upload to Amazon S3 storage and removes all resources already uploaded.
member.param: Unique identifier for multipart upload process to external storage. Is obtained by .

member.name: T:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader
member.summary: Class for uploading large files to Amazon S3 storage.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.#ctor(Amazon.S3.AmazonS3Client,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates utility for uploading large files in smaller parts to Amazon S3 storage.
member.param: Client for accessing the Amazon S3 storage.
Minimal size of the part sent in one request to Amazon S3 storage.
Maximal possible size of the part sent in one request to Amazon S3 storage.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.InitMultiPartUpload(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Inits multipart upload with given inside with Amazon S3 storage.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
member.returns: Upload ID, unique identifier for one multipart upload to Amazon S3 storage. Returned upload ID is needed for each subsequent multipart upload operation.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.UploadPartFromStream(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Uploads one part of a file to Amazon S3 storage.
member.remarks: If some of the Amazon S3 policies about multipart upload is violated then exception will be thrown. For example, if part smaller than 5 MB is uploaded and given part is not the last part of the multipart upload process.
member.param: Unique identifier for one multipart upload. Can be obtained by method.
Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
Number that defines position of the data obtained by the stream in the whole multipart upload process.
Stream with data to upload. Supplied stream has always it's position set to origin.
member.returns: Unique identifier of the uploaded part.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.UploadFromStream(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Uploads one large file to Amazon S3 storage in smaller parts.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
Stream with data to upload. Supplied stream has always it's position set to origin.
member.returns: Response containing metadata of uploaded file.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.UploadFromFilePath(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Uploads large file from local file system to Amazon S3 storage in smaller parts.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
member.returns: Response contains metadata of uploaded file like ETag.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.CompleteMultiPartUploadProcess(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Amazon.S3.Model.UploadPartResponse})
member.summary: Completes multiple part upload process. Sends final request to Amazon S3 to merge all parts already sent to storage.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
Unique identifier for one multipart upload. Can be obtained by method.
List of responses from Amazon S3 received after uploading each part.
member.returns: Response from Amazon S3 storage after finishing the multipart upload.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.AbortMultiPartUpload(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Aborts multipart upload, so Amazon S3 storage can delete uploaded parts.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
Unique identifier for one multipart upload. Can be obtained by method.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.MultiPartUploadFromStream(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Uploads one large file stored in to Amazon S3 storage in smaller parts.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
Stream with data to upload. Supplied stream has always it's position set to origin.
member.returns: Response from Amazon S3 storage after finishing the multipart upload. Response contains metadata of the uploaded file.

member.name: M:CMS.AmazonStorage.S3MultiPartUploader.CreateUploadPartRequest(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates first request used for multipart upload.
member.param: Unique identifier for an object within a bucket.
Unique identifier for one multipart upload. Can be obtained by method.
member.returns: Returns first request used for multipart upload.

member.summary: Sets metadata from response acquired from Amazon S3 storage to S3ObjectInfo.
member.param: Representation of the file on Amazon S3 storage.
ETag assigned to file uploaded to Amazon S3 storage.

Amazon S3 storage does not return length of the uploaded file in , if the file was uploaded via multipart upload. In case of multipart upload is of the set via this parameter.
